name: parametric-svg-patch
description: Update a parametric SVG element with new data. A low-level library.

scripts.clean:
git reset && echo '/node_modules/' > .gitignore && git add .gitignore && git stash save --include-untracked --keep-index '`npm run clean` trash can' && git clean --force -d && git reset --hard && echo '
clean: Uncommitted and ignored files have been moved to gitâ€™s stash. To restore them run `git stash pop --quiet; git checkout .gitignore`.'
scripts.coverage: rm -rf coverage && npm run test:transpile && cd .es5 && istanbul cover test.js && mv coverage ..
scripts.prepublish: npm run --silent clean && npm run transpile
scripts.test: eslint . && npm run test:transpile && node .es5/test.js | tap-spec
scripts.test:transpile: rimraf .es5 && babel test.js module/*.js --out-dir .es5 && mkdirp .es5/node_modules/parametric-svg-spec/specs && cpy 'node_modules/parametric-svg-spec/specs/*' .es5/node_modules/parametric-svg-spec/specs
scripts.view-coverage: echo 'Generating coverage reports...'; npm run coverage >/dev/null && echo '...done.' && opn ./coverage/lcov-report/index.html >/dev/null

author: Tomek Wiszniewski <t.wiszniewski@gmail.com>
